name: Marcus Iunius Brutus
description: Marcus Iunius Brutus, Roman politician and murderer of Caesar - Although Brutus owed his life to Caesar and was a profiteer of his regime, Brutus turned his back on Caesar as his friend proclaimed permanent autocracy in 44 BC. Brutus placed the ideal of freedom above gratitude and honor. For the rest of his life he was haunted by Caesar's assassination. The torment of betrayal accompanied him till death.
